text.p: These are the leading stories in the Egyptian press on Saturday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

- China's president, during the visit by Prime Minister Kamal Ganzouri to China, praises the policies on Middle East peace of President Hosni Mubarak. Five agreements between the two countries are signed, including one on electricity and another on trade.
China agrees to send a delegation of experts to Egypt to look into setting up a free trade zone.
- Economy and International Cooperation Minister Nawal el-Tatawi says reserves are $19.1 billion, and that the economy has developed to achieve gross domestic product of 4.9 percent in 95/96.
- 51 Egyptians evacuated from Zaire are returning to Cairo today.

- Third and final tranche of 16 companies to be sold to the public on the bourse will take place after the Eid al-Adha feast, says Public Enterprise Minister Atef Obeid. The sale will be at prevailing prices. After the sale, 90 percent of these companies' shares will have been transferred to private ownership. Their value over 6 billion pounds.
